Participant identification number: Participants affirming that they will complete the full survey. This is used to reduce attitrion (Zhou & Fishbach, 2016)
Participant Race (1 = White, 2 = Black, 3 = American Indian or Alaskan Native, 4 = Asian, 5 = Native Hawaiian of other Pacific Islander, 6 = Biracial)
Participant political identification (1 = extremely liberal; 7 = extremely conservative)
Position on corporate taxes (1 = for, 2 = against, 3 = I don't know)
Positon on climate change (1 = for, 2 = against, 3 = I don't know)

subjID: Run for President of the USA

Participant identification number: The above options in rows 14-19 were used as an instructional manipulation check (Oppenheimer, Meyvis, & Davidenko, 2009). Participants were instructed to ignore all options and select "Run for president of the USA. Thus, anyone who failed this attention check was excluded as per our preregistered plan (see manuscript for more details).
Participant received a simple or complex policy (simple = 0; complex = 1)
Participant received a policy was for or against on that issue (for = 0; against = 1)
Belief-consistency: whether the policy participants received a policy that was for or against their initial position (Consistent = 1, Inconsistent = 2, No preference = 3)
Issue participants received (climate change = 0; corporate taxes = 1)
Composite of policy attitude favorability questions (higher numbers mean more favorable: 1-7 scale)
